for_sales.sales_text:
Panecea is an 18’ Gaff cutter that I want to pass on to someone who would be interested in restoring her to sailing condition. My sailing days are over, and it breaks my heart to think that she has the same future.

She was built in Woodbridge, Suffolk by Steve Prout, Obsolete Boats, for his personal enjoyment.

Up until 2017, I sailed her in Dublin Bay, but she is now stored at the small townland of Donaghmore in Co Wexford. She is on a site that is now earmarked for landscaping. 

Her current condition She is laid-up ashore.

All sails, spars and rigging are in good condition but in a neglected state.

SAILS She has a (Tan Terylene) Main with one Reef Row, (Tan Terylene) staysail, (Cream Terylene) roller jib with Davies brass/phosphor bronze furling gear, and a (Cream Terylene) Topsail. All sheets, lines, stays, Running back-stays are in good nic. Timber blocks are servicable.

HULL Built in fiberglass it is in very good condition, needing some paintwork and antifouling. Internal varnishing needs extensive renewal.

ENGINE Inboard Petter Marine Diesel TYPE AC1WM single cylinder, electric start (also has a hand cranker). She is water cooled. She has a stainless fuel tank in the bilges. She has a three bladed propeller (12" x 8") driven by a reversing gearbox on a 25mm shaft. Control panel is under the helmsman’s bench. Electrical wiring needs renovation. Starting battery is housed in one of two lockers small lockers by the mast.

PUMPS Manual Whale Gusher Bilge pump is located under the cockpit bench. An automatic electric pump is located in the engine bilge.

She is a long-keel design and has two legs that attach to the hull for drying out.

TRAILER She has a 4 Wheel trailer on roadworthy condition. It was never used to launch Panacea into water. All bearings were removed and overhauled in Spring 2019 prior to her last re-location.

boat.full_description:
Panacea was built in 1997 as the first of six intended builds to a design by Stephen Prout in Woodbridge, Suffolk. In the event she was the only one built. Stephen sailed her extensively around the Suffolk, Essex and Thames Estuary coastline before selling her in 2010.

Her next owner took her to the South West of Ireland on her trailer where she was sailed locally until 2012 when she was sold on again.

After being trailered to Dun Laoghaire Harbour she sank on her moorings in the inner harbour (a botched stern gland re-packing prior to re-purchase). Since being raised, she has sailed on the East Coast of Ireland between Howth and Wicklow.

She has been laid up in a field in Wexford since 2018, and passed into new ownership 2019.
boat.home_port: Ashore at Donaghmore, Co. Wexford, Ireland
boat.name: Panacea
boat.short_description: Panacea was the first (and only) boat of her class, designed by Stephen Prout
